subject: Sleep
title: Dangers of Lucid Dream Obsession
description: A 60-second lesson on Dangers of Lucid Dream Obsession.

hook.text: Some people become so obsessed with lucid dreaming that they start sleeping 12 hours a day to chase it.

buildup.text: Techniques like WBTB involve setting alarms at 4 AM, fragmenting sleep to increase REM awareness.

discovery.text: Frequent sleep disruption for lucid dreaming practice can degrade actual sleep quality over time.

twist.text: Some lucid dreamers report blurred lines between dreams and reality, causing anxiety while awake.

climax.text: The pursuit of dream control can paradoxically lead to less rest and more waking-world confusion.

punchline.text: Chasing dream control can cost you real sleep.

quiz.question: What is a risk of aggressive lucid dreaming techniques?
